revised_title: The Thyroid Body and Its Function in Vocal Production
tldr: The author, Peter Martyn, investigates the role of the thyroid gland in vocal production. He posits that the gland provides rigidity, tension, and flexibility to the vocal cords, allowing for a wide range of tones and pitches. Additionally, the thyroid gland acts as a loader, enhancing the sonorous quality of the voice. This function is essential for the perfection of human speech and expression.
